The Israeli Tennis Center is more than just a place to buy equipment - it is home to Israeli tennis tradition. We offer Israel's leading tennis equipment store, combining classic heritage with modern technology. With many years of experience, we specialize in providing professional tennis equipment for players of all levels - from beginners to professional champions. Test test test test

Our parents trust us to guide their talented children in selecting the most suitable equipment for their developmental stage.

home_p_26: The Israeli Tennis Center draws upon the rich heritage of classic tennis. We believe in traditional sports values - discipline, perseverance, and good sportsmanship. Our approach combines the wisdom of previous generations of tennis players with the most advanced technology in the industry. Peace and blessings
home_p_27: In our tennis equipment store in Israel, you'll find a wide range of products that reflect this approach - from classic wooden rackets for display, to professional tennis equipment using advanced materials like graphite and carbon. Every item is carefully selected to preserve heritage while providing maximum performance.
home_p_28: Precise stringing by certified technicians with years of experience. We use only the highest quality strings and adjust the tension precisely to your playing style.
home_p_29: Specialization in tennis rackets for beginner children - careful selection of lightweight rackets, in appropriate sizes and with perfect balance point for developing proper technique from a young age.
home_p_30: Our expert team provides personal consultation for selecting professional tennis equipment that perfectly matches each player's skill level, playing style, and personal goals.
home_p_31: At the Israeli Tennis Center, we offer the most comprehensive and professional selection of tennis equipment in Israel. From the most advanced rackets by leading world brands, to special tennis shoes for every surface type - we guarantee you'll find exactly what you need.
home_p_32: Selection of tennis rackets from leading world brands - Wilson, Head, Babolat and more. Each racket is selected according to strict criteria of quality and performance.
home_p_33: Special collection of tennis rackets for beginner children in all sizes - 19", 21", 23", 25" and 26". Each racket is adapted to age, height and skill level.
home_p_34: Professional tennis shoes adapted to every surface type - hard court, clay or grass. Additionally, a wide range of quality tennis apparel in classic style.
home_p_35: Comprehensive selection of quality strings, grips, shock absorbers, bags and additional accessories from leading industry brands.
home_p_36: If you're players who train regularly, participate in local tournaments and are looking for professional tennis equipment that will help you advance - you've come to the right place. The Israeli Tennis Center offers a wide range of quality equipment and professional services that will perfectly suit your needs.
home_p_37: Our professional team will help you choose the perfect racket, the right strings and all the accompanying equipment that will allow you to reach the next level in your game. We understand the unique needs of competitive players and provide personally tailored solutions.
home_p_38: Dear parents, we understand how important it is for you to provide your children with the best tools for success in tennis. At the Israeli Tennis Center, we specialize in tennis rackets for beginner children and equipment specially adapted for young ages.
home_p_39: Our team will help you choose the racket that's perfectly suited to your child's age, height and skill level. We believe that a proper start with suitable equipment is the foundation for professional development in the future. Additionally, we offer consultation regarding professional courses and training programs that will help your child realize their potential.
home_p_40: Years of experience in professional tennis, with an expert team that understands the sport deeply and knows exactly what each player needs.
home_p_41: Only the highest quality products from leading world brands. We guarantee that every item meets the highest standards.
home_p_42: Personal customization for each customer - we dedicate time to understand your unique needs and provide precisely tailored solutions.

new_p_168: How to extend the life of your racket and strings? Important tips for proper maintenance that will save you money and improve your performance on the court.

new_p_185: The decision to enter the world of tennis is an exciting one. It's a sport that combines physical fitness, strategic thinking, and great enjoyment. However, the moment you walk into a tennis equipment store in Israel and stand in front of a wall full of colorful and different rackets can be very confusing. Should you choose the most expensive racket? Does the brand matter? And what do all those small numbers printed on the frame mean?
new_p_186: At the Israeli Tennis Center, we believe that the right equipment is the key to rapid progress and enjoyment of the game. An unsuitable racket can not only harm your playing ability, but even cause unnecessary injuries. In this guide, we'll break down the selection process into simple factors that will help you make the right decision.
new_p_188: One of the common mistakes of beginner players is thinking that a feather-light racket is the ideal choice. While a light racket (under 270 grams) allows for faster and easier hand movement, it also transmits stronger shocks to the arm when hitting the ball. For a beginner adult player, the recommendation is usually to choose a medium-weight racket, ranging between 270 to 300 grams.
new_p_189: This weight provides better stability when hitting, helps generate natural power without over-exerting the muscles, and still allows good control of movement. If you're purchasing a racket for a child or teenager, the weights will obviously be lower, and it's recommended to consult with our experts in the store.
new_p_191: The racket head size is measured in square inches. For beginners, the keyword is 'forgiveness'. The larger the racket head, the larger the 'Sweet Spot' - the area in the center of the strings where hitting the ball is most optimal. When we're just learning the technique, we don't always hit the center of the racket with perfect precision.
new_p_192: Therefore, it's recommended to choose a racket with a head size of 100 square inches and above (up to 110 square inches). A larger head will help you get the ball to the other side of the net even when the hit isn't perfect, and will give you much more confidence in your initial game.
new_p_194: A critical parameter that is sometimes neglected is the grip thickness (Grip Size). A grip that's too thick or too thin will cause you to strain your forearm muscles excessively, which can lead to inflammation and pain (like 'tennis elbow'). The sizes are usually marked with numbers from 0 to 5.
new_p_195: A simple rule of thumb for checking: hold the racket as if you're shaking hands. In the gap created between your fingertips and palm pad, exactly one finger from your other hand should fit. If the gap is too large, the grip is too thick; if there's no room for a finger, the grip is too thin. At the Israeli Tennis Center, we can measure your palm and fit you with the exact size.
new_p_197: Choosing your first racket is your first step into the world of tennis. Don't be tempted to buy the most expensive racket or the one a famous player uses on TV. Focus on comfort, appropriate weight, and head size that will allow you to learn and enjoy. We invite you to come to us, feel the rackets in your hand, and receive personal and professional advice.
new_p_209: Quality tennis equipment is a significant financial investment. Whether you're amateur or professional players, your racket, shoes, and bag are the tools that enable you to play and succeed. Many of the customers who come to the Israeli Tennis Center ask us how to extend the life of equipment and maintain its performance over time. The answer lies in regular maintenance and attention to small details.
new_p_210: In this article, we've compiled several essential tips that will help you keep your equipment in excellent condition, save money on frequent replacements, and ensure you always step onto the court with the best tools.
new_p_212: Enemy number one of tennis equipment, especially strings and frame, is heat. Leaving your racket in the car on a hot Israeli summer day is a recipe for disaster. The intense heat causes the racket frame (usually made of graphite and composite materials) to expand and deform at micro-levels, and the strings to lose their tension quickly. The result is a racket that feels 'dead' and less responsive.
new_p_213: Our recommendation: always take the bag with you. Don't leave it in the trunk. At home, store the equipment in a shaded and cool place. Using an insulated tennis bag (with thermal lining) can help protect the equipment on your way to and from the court.
new_p_215: The grip is your only point of contact with the racket. A worn, dirty, or slippery grip not only hurts your game but also forces you to hold the racket too tightly, leading to forearm muscle fatigue and injuries. There's no need to wait for the grip to completely fall apart. The moment you feel that the grip isn't stable or doesn't absorb sweat properly - replace it.
new_p_216: It's recommended to use a thin and cheap Overgrip (top grip tape) that can be replaced frequently, thus preserving the racket's base grip for years. At a tennis equipment store in Israel, you can find a variety of grip types in different thicknesses and textures.
new_p_218: Many players only replace strings when they break. This is a mistake. Strings lose their flexibility and tension (Tension Loss) long before they physically break. 'Dead' strings transmit more shock to the hand and hurt ball control. A common rule of thumb is to replace strings as many times as you play per week (for example, if you play 3 times a week, replace strings 3 times a year).
new_p_219: At the Israeli Tennis Center, we offer professional stringing service that will restore the liveliness and power your racket has lost. Don't neglect the strings ‚Äì they are the engine of your racket.
new_p_221: Proper equipment care is an integral part of being tennis players. Maintaining your racket, replacing grips on time, and protecting from the sun will ensure better performance and financial savings over time. Do you have additional questions about maintenance? Our team is always here to serve you.
new_p_233: When entering a sports store, it's easy to get confused by the enormous range of prices. Why does one racket cost 250 NIS and another, which looks quite similar, costs 1,200 NIS? Is it just about branding and marketing, or are there fundamental differences that will affect your game? At the Israeli Tennis Center, we believe it's important for customers to understand exactly what they're paying for.
new_p_234: The differences between recreational equipment and performance equipment are significant and relate to materials, manufacturing technology, and precision levels. Let's dive deep and understand the main differences.
new_p_236: The most significant difference is the material the racket is made from. Cheap beginner rackets are usually made of aluminum or simple alloy. These are very durable and cheap to manufacture rackets, but they transmit strong vibrations to the hand, are relatively heavier, and lack 'feel'. They're excellent for children just starting out or for those who play once a month.
new_p_237: In contrast, professional rackets are made from carbon fiber (graphite) and advanced composite materials (like Graphene, Kevlar, and more). These materials are amazingly light and strong. They allow manufacturers to control with great precision the stiffness and flexibility levels of the racket in different areas, giving the player power, control, and vibration absorption at a completely different level.
new_p_239: Professional equipment involves extensive research and development. New technologies are designed to improve the racket's stability when hitting the ball. When a tennis ball hits the racket at high speed, the racket tends to rotate in the hand (torque moment). Professional rackets are designed to resist this twisting, allowing for more accurate shots even when the hit isn't in the center of the racket.
new_p_240: Additionally, the dampening systems in professional rackets are built into the handle and frame, protecting the player's joints over time. For a player who plays several times a week, this protection is critical for injury prevention.
new_p_242: The answer depends on your playing frequency and goals. If you play once every two weeks for fun, an intermediate racket will do an excellent job. But if you plan to play regularly, take lessons, and improve, investing in professional equipment (or at least quality 'Club Player' equipment) pays off. The equipment will last longer, protect your body, and allow you to reach your full potential.
new_p_244: The difference between equipment isn't just in price, but in the overall playing experience. We invite you to visit our store, consult with experts, and maybe even take a demo racket for a trial. Only when you feel the difference in your hands will you understand how much the right equipment can upgrade your game.
new_p_262: Tennis is one of the most dynamic sports there is. The game requires sharp movements, sudden stops, lateral jumps and short sprint runs. Within all this intense activity, the most important equipment protecting your body is not the racket, but the shoes. At the Israeli Tennis Center we meet players daily who invest a fortune in rackets, but neglect choosing the right shoes ‚Äì a mistake that can lead to injuries and impaired performance.
new_p_263: Choosing the right tennis shoe is critical for stability on the court, preventing sprains and protecting the knees and back. Whether you're beginner or professional players, the following guide will help you understand what to look for when you enter a tennis equipment store in Israel.
new_p_265: The first and most important parameter in choosing a shoe is the type of court you play on most of the time. Each surface has different requirements from the sole:
new_p_270: When you visit the Israeli Tennis Center or any professional store, you'll notice that tennis shoes are usually divided into two main categories: shoes that focus on stability and shoes that focus on speed.
new_p_271: Stability shoes: Will usually be heavier and more massive. They are designed for players who need maximum ankle support, or for physical and strong players who move a lot on the baseline. They provide great confidence in lateral movements.
new_p_272: Speed shoes: Lightweight, more flexible and breathable shoes. They suit players who want to feel "close to the court" and move at top speed. The downside is that sometimes they wear out faster and provide less ankle support.
new_p_274: Many make the mistake of buying tennis shoes in the same size as their walking shoes. In tennis, the foot tends to swell slightly during play, and movements include strong stops. Therefore, the rule of thumb is to leave a gap of about half a centimeter to a centimeter between the big toe and the shoe's end.
new_p_275: If your toes touch the shoe's end when measuring in the store, it will hurt a lot during play. Additionally, it's important to pay attention to the shoe's width. Different brands manufacture lasts in different widths. Don't compromise on a tight shoe hoping it will stretch ‚Äì a tennis shoe should be comfortable from the first moment.
new_p_277: Professional tennis equipment is designed to last, but every shoe has an expiration date. Clear signs for replacement include sole wear to the point where grooves disappear (causing dangerous slipping), or when you feel the shoe has lost its shock absorption ability and knees start hurting after training.
new_p_278: An average player who plays twice a week will need to replace shoes every 4-6 months. Competitive players replace at a much higher frequency.
new_p_280: Your feet are the most important tool on the court. Don't underestimate choosing the right shoe. We invite you to come to the tennis equipment store in Israel at our complex, consult with the experts at the Israeli Tennis Center, and try on various models to find the perfect pair that will improve your game and maintain your health.

about_h3_9: Israeli Tennis Center - preserving the heritage of classic tennis for many years
about_p_29: The Israeli Tennis Center was founded from a deep love for the sport of tennis and from an understanding that quality equipment and professional service are the key to success on the court. From the beginning, our vision was clear - to be the leading tennis equipment store in Israel, combining classic tradition with modern and professional service.
about_p_30: Over the years, we have seen generations of passionate tennis players pass through our doors. From young children who received their first tennis rackets, through talented youth who developed into competitive players, to adults who found a new passion in tennis. Each of them contributed to our story and helped us better understand the diverse needs of the Israeli tennis community.
about_p_31: Today, the Israeli Tennis Center is more than a place to buy equipment - it's a community center for tennis lovers, a place where knowledge, experiences, and professional tips are shared. We are proud to be part of every player's journey, from the first steps to great achievements.
about_p_32: We compromise only on the best. Every piece of professional tennis equipment we offer is carefully selected and meets the highest standards. We work only with the world's leading brands and guarantee that every product will deliver excellent performance.
about_p_33: Tennis is not just work for us - it's a passion. Every member of our team is a tennis player or sports lover, and we bring this love to every interaction with customers. We believe that the love of sport is what creates the best service.
about_p_34: Our customers' success is our success. We dedicate time to understanding each player's unique needs and provide personalized solutions. Our commitment is to accompany you throughout the entire journey, from the first purchase to continuous improvement.
about_p_35: We see our customers as part of the Israeli Tennis Center family. We create long-term relationships, share knowledge and experience, and organize community events. Our community is a source of inspiration and mutual support.
about_p_36: We believe in the importance of education and knowledge. In addition to selling equipment, we provide professional guidance on equipment selection, maintenance, and game improvement. Especially when it comes to tennis rackets for beginner children, we dedicate time to explain to parents the importance of the right equipment.
about_p_37: We maintain the classic tradition of tennis while adopting modern innovation. Our approach combines the wisdom of generations with current technology, creating a unique experience that respects the past and looks to the future.
about_p_38: The Israeli Tennis Center team consists of experienced experts in the field of tennis, including former players, certified coaches, and skilled technicians. Each team member brings unique experience and genuine passion for the sport.
about_p_39: Our team includes tennis equipment specialists with decades of experience. Each team member has undergone professional training and is continuously updated on the latest technologies in the tennis industry.
about_p_40: Our technicians have international certifications in racket stringing. They undergo continuous training and work with the most advanced equipment to ensure accurate and quality stringing.
about_p_41: A special team specializing in equipment fitting for children and youth. They understand the unique needs of young players and help parents choose the most suitable tennis rackets for beginner children.
about_p_42: Specialists who specialize in fitting professional tennis equipment for competitive players. They analyze playing style and provide precise recommendations for improving performance on the court.
about_p_43: The Israeli Tennis Center is proud of its classic heritage. We believe that tennis is a sport of tradition, elegance, and sportsmanship. The classic design of our store, with deep green and white tones, reflects these values and recalls the golden age of tennis.
about_p_44: We maintain this tradition in every aspect of the business - from how we treat customers, through product selection, to store design and the atmosphere we create. When you enter the Israeli Tennis Center, you're not just buying equipment - you're experiencing part of the sport's rich history.
about_p_45: At the same time, we don't stay in the past. We combine tradition with the most advanced technology - from rackets with modern materials to computerized stringing systems. This combination of old and new is what makes the Israeli Tennis Center special.
about_p_46: We believe in the importance of developing the next generation of tennis players. Therefore, we offer special programs for parents and children, including discounts on tennis rackets for beginner children, educational workshops, and support for local youth tournaments.
about_p_47: We are active in the Israeli tennis community and support events, tournaments, and local clubs. Our goal is not just to sell equipment, but to contribute to the growth and development of tennis in Israel.
about_p_48: Whether you are beginner or professional players, we treat every customer with the same level of professionalism and attention. We believe that every player, regardless of their level, deserves the best equipment and the most professional service.
about_p_49: We continuously update ourselves on the latest technologies in the tennis industry. Our team participates in international conferences, undergoes advanced training, and brings the latest knowledge to our customers.
about_p_50: The Israeli Tennis Center was founded with a clear vision - to be the leading tennis equipment store in Israel, combining classic tradition with modern service. The first store opened with a small but quality selection of equipment from leading brands.
about_p_51: Over time, we expanded the variety and services. We added a professional stringing department, expanded the product range, and began specializing in tennis rackets for beginner children - an area we identified as lacking in the Israeli market.
about_p_52: We became a household name in the Israeli tennis community. Professional players, clubs, and coaches began turning to us for equipment and professional consultation. Our team expanded and became even more specialized.
about_p_53: Today, the Israeli Tennis Center is more than a place to buy equipment - it's a community center for tennis lovers. We continue to innovate, develop, and maintain classic tradition while adopting the latest technologies.
about_p_54: Come visit us and experience for yourself the unique combination of tradition, professionalism, and love for tennis. Our team is waiting to welcome you warmly and help you find the perfect equipment.

new_h3_163: How to Choose Tennis Shoes - Professional Guide
new_li_266: Hard Courts: This is the most common surface in Israel. Shoes for hard courts must be very durable, with a strong sole that will withstand the high wear of concrete and asphalt. They provide excellent cushioning for shock absorption.
new_li_267: Clay Courts: The sole of clay shoes is designed in a "herringbone" pattern (full zigzag) to prevent clay accumulation in the grooves and allow controlled sliding to the ball.
new_li_268: Grass Courts: Rarer in Israel, but requires a sole with small studs for maximum grip on the slippery surface.

services_h1_1: Professional Services of the Israeli Tennis Center
services_h2_5: Equipment Fitting for Children and Youth
services_h2_6: Equipment Fitting for Children and Youth
services_p_36: The Israeli Tennis Center offers a wide range of professional services tailored to the unique needs of every player. Whether you are passionate tennis players looking for the highest quality professional tennis equipment, or parents interested in finding tennis rackets for beginner children - we are here to help.
services_p_37: As Israel's leading tennis equipment store, we combine classic tradition with modern and professional service. Our experienced team brings years of experience in the tennis field and specializes in personal customization of equipment and solutions for every playing level.
services_p_38: Our stringing service is one of the most professional and precise in Israel. We use advanced stringing machines and quality strings from the world's leading brands. Our certified technicians undergo continuous training and stay updated with the latest technologies.
services_p_39: Our stringing service is one of the most professional and precise in Israel. We use advanced stringing machines and quality strings from the world's leading brands. Our certified technicians undergo continuous training and stay updated with the latest technologies.
services_p_40: We specialize in tennis rackets for beginner children and understand the importance of choosing the right equipment for age and developmental stage. An unsuitable racket can harm technique and lead to injuries, while the right racket will help the child develop a strong foundation for future play.
services_p_41: We specialize in tennis rackets for beginner children and understand the importance of choosing the right equipment for age and developmental stage. An unsuitable racket can harm technique and lead to injuries, while the right racket will help the child develop a strong foundation for future play.
services_p_42: Our professional consulting service is designed for passionate tennis players interested in improving their game through personally customized professional tennis equipment. Our team includes former players and certified coaches who understand the technical nuances of the game.
services_p_43: Our professional consulting service is designed for passionate tennis players interested in improving their game through personally customized professional tennis equipment. Our team includes former players and certified coaches who understand the technical nuances of the game.
services_p_44: Professional repair services for damaged rackets - grip replacement, frame repair, shock absorber replacement and more. We restore your old racket to its new feel.
services_p_45: Perfect equipment packages for beginners - including racket, bag, balls, additional grip and accessories. Special price for complete packages that cover all basic needs.
services_p_46: Professional workshops on equipment selection, racket maintenance, understanding strings and more. Special training days for parents and young players on all technical aspects of equipment.
services_p_47: Special program for parents - racket exchange at a discounted price when the child grows and requires a new size. Ensures the child always plays with the most suitable equipment for their age.
services_p_48: Personal meeting to understand needs, playing level and goals. In-depth analysis of playing style and existing equipment.
services_p_49: Our team offers several personally customized options, with detailed explanation of the advantages of each option.
services_p_50: Option to try the recommended equipment, with fine adjustments according to personal feel and comfort.
services_p_51: Post-purchase follow-up, ongoing technical support and updates on new products that might suit you.
services_p_52: Team with years of experience in professional tennis, including former players and coaches
services_p_53: Only products from the world's leading brands, with full manufacturer warranty
services_p_54: Personal attention to every customer, with time dedicated to understanding unique needs
services_p_55: Competitive and transparent prices, with special deals for packages and regular customers
services_p_56: Convenient opening hours, option to schedule appointments outside regular operating hours
services_p_57: Long-term relationship with customers, with follow-up on development and changing needs
services_p_58: "The Israeli Tennis Center helped me find the perfect racket. The professional consulting and stringing service took my game to a completely different level. Highly recommend!"
services_p_59: "As a parent of a talented child in tennis, I was looking for a place that would understand the special needs. The team here is professional and caring, and they helped my son find the equipment exactly suited to his age and level."
services_p_60: "The service here is on another level. Professional stringing, personal consulting and attention to small details. This isn't just an equipment store - it's a place where they truly understand tennis."
services_p_61: Contact us now to schedule a personal consultation meeting. Our professional team will be happy to help you find the perfect solution for your needs.
services_p_62: ¬© 2026 The Israeli Tennis Center. All rights reserved.

legal_terms_p_18: The services are provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. The company shall not be liable for indirect, consequential or special damages arising from use of the website, except in cases where the law provides otherwise.
legal_terms_p_19: All content on the website, including texts, images, design and code, are protected by copyrights belonging to [business_name]. It is prohibited to copy, distribute or make commercial use of the content without written permission.
legal_terms_p_20: Collection and use of personal information is subject to our privacy policy. Use of the website constitutes agreement to the privacy policy as detailed separately.
legal_terms_p_21: The company may change these terms of use at any time. Material changes will be published on the website with 30 days' advance notice. Continued use after the change constitutes agreement to the new terms.
legal_terms_p_22: The company may discontinue or restrict the service at any time, including in case of violation of the terms of use. In case of service termination, the provisions of the relevant sections will remain in effect.
legal_terms_p_23: These terms of use are subject to the laws of the State of Israel. Any dispute will be heard in the competent courts in Israel, with preference given to arbitration or mediation where possible.
legal_terms_p_24: For questions or clarifications regarding the terms of use:
